sense.def: Alternative Names lian mei chuang 煉眉瘡 , tempered eyebrows sores; mian yan chuang 面湮瘡 , facial clog-up sores; lian yin xian 煉銀癬 , tempered silver xuan -illness; lian yin chuang 煉銀瘡 , tempered silver sores. Pathological Condition of chuang 瘡 , sores, conditions, which develop on the eyebrows of children. They fester with seeping liquid, itch, and peel, and cannot be cured over an extended period of time. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Substance Entry lu 驢 quotes Tai ping sheng hui fang 太平聖惠方 : 小兒眉瘡：黑驢 屎燒研，油調塗，立效 , “ Eyebrow sores in children: Roast black donkey feces and grind to a powder, mix with oil and apply externally. Immediately effective”. Mei he ge qi 梅核膈氣 , plum-pit occlusion qi [1]

Alternative Names qi ye 氣噎 , qi-induced gullet occlusion. Pathological Condition of an uncomfortable feeling of a blockage caused by an alien object in the gullet which one is unable to remove by vomiting and swallowing. The Chi shui xuan zhu Medical case histories. Ming era.Not 赤水玄珠 found in BCGM. 1573. , published only five years prior to the Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 , offers the earliest known reference to a term mei he qi 梅核氣 , plum-pit qi [occluding the throat]. LSZ may have coined the new term 梅核膈氣 by combining the two very different disease concepts of 梅核氣 and ge qi 膈氣 膈氣 , ge qi , occlusion qi, with a new term. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Substance Entry mei 梅 quotes Gong shi jing yan fang Recipe book. Ming era. 龔氏經驗方 : 梅核膈氣, 取半青半黃梅子，每個用鹽一兩淹一 日夜，矖乾又浸又曬，至水盡乃止。用青錢三個，夾二梅，麻綫縛定， 通裝磁罐內，封埋地下，百日取出。每用一枚，含之嚥汁，入喉即消 , “For plum-pit occlusion qi : Take plums half-green half-yellow and cover each with 1 liang of salt for 1 day and 1 night. Next dry them under the sun, then immerse them [in salt] again, and then dry them again. Stop when all the water has gone. Then take 3 copper coins to enclose 2 plums, bind them together firmly with a hemp thread. This is then placed into an earthen jar, which is to be sealed and buried in the earth. Take them out after 100 days. For each [treatment] use one piece, hold it in the mouth and swallow the juice. When it enters the throat it will dissolve [the blockage]”.
